Who: RODIMUS PRIME, Kup, Nightlight
Location: Black Fortress - Hallways

e while she left her hide out"i tried to reach the
> throne room... I"
>
> =
She Gasped, she saw the autobot's symbol in Rodimus's chest, she felt
> sur=
priced and betrayed. Tears started to fell down, she loved him but he
> bet=
rayed her faction; everithing that he told were lies. She just liked to
> m=
ove a way there, and ran, without realize towards the cell block area.

As =
Nightlight ran Rodimus quickly shifted into vehicular mode again
and drove =
after her, using his superior speed to hopefully over take
her.

"Nightligh=
t!" he said, calling her by the only name that he has ever
known her by. "I=
t is still me Rodimus, the one who has sworn on his
life to protect you fro=
m all harm!" Rodimus tried to swerve on front
of and transformed again.

"I=
t's me! Don't you still trust me?" He said, pain obvious in his
voice, pain=
 from her dismissal of him, of her fear of him. "I remember
it all!" he sai=
d, his voice taking on a note of urgencey as he spoke,
"I know who you were=
, and who you are, and most importantly who we are
and what we meant to eac=
h other." His words spilling over with
conviction as he talked.

He gesture=
d to her as if he would embrace her in a hug if she would
let him, "I have =
come to fulfill a promise that I made to you not only
earlier but the one I=
 made to years ago, that you and I would always
be one spark, and that noth=
ing would harm you as long as I lived."

Rodimus' head lights brightened, "=
And there is another that would want
you to remember as well." A small imag=
e began to appear in the midst
of Rodimus headlights as a viewscreen appear=
ed. In it was a picture of
a young female Autobot: Elita.

As Rodimus spoke=
 chatter from the other Autobots could be heard . . .

> " This is Tucson P=
rime, I copy you Rodimus Prime. Although your words are encouraging, I must=
 say I meet them with a bit of apprehension myself. I will do everything in=
 my power to keep the peace among us, but do keep in mind, trust will be th=
e most difficult thing to gain among our faction. You have turned against u=
s in the past, served our enemy faithfully, and for that, many of us are le=
ary of your return to our side. You show a vulnerability to be easilly sway=
ed and in order to regain your status among us, you must prove you can over=
come this vulnerability. So it is with this in mind, that I request you pas=
s a test of loyalty toward our faction. A test that only I can adiminister,=
 and a test only I can deem you worthy of passing. And until such time that=
 I have deemed you worthy of this task, leadership of the Autobots will be =
diverted to me, and none of my orders are to be disobeyed. Do I have your w=
ord and compliance Rodimus Prime?"

"I copy you as well Tuscon." Rodimus' v=
oice came over the transmission
lines, that new sense of conviction transit=
ting loud and clear across
it. "We all have our tests to pass and fail and =
I have failed mine,
but it is not just you or your worthiness that I have t=
o live up but
all the Autobots and the matrix itself."

Rodimus paused as h=
e looked at Nightlight wanting her to hear the
words he spoke to. "Inside o=
f all of us is a darkness and weakness and
fear, any of which can be exploi=
ted if one finds the right key, the
right leverage. To deny it is to forget=
 that we are living beings. We
all have to focus and remember who we are an=
d where we stand. I had
forgotten that, but I shall not forget it again."

=
Rodimus smiled at Nightlight, that smile also carried into his voice
as he =
spoke, "Sometimes it is not our successes that teach us, but our
failures. =
Tuscon, you have led the Autobots well in my absence, and
you will continue=
 to do so I have no doubt. There is too much that
stands between me and any=
 command right now."

"However I caution you, the mantle of the command wei=
ghs heavy on the
head of those who bear it."

Rodimus looked at Nightlight =
as he wondered what she would do.
